key_title: Key to the subspecies of Asplenium trichomanes

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the species of Asplenium

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Rhizome scales up to 5 mm long, with central dark brown stripe; upper pinnae convex with inrolled margins, or less commonly, flat; spores 32–45 µm in diameter (growing on limestone, e.g. at lower Glenelg River, Ensay–Buchan, Limestone Creek near the Cobberas)

Rhizome scales up to 3.5 mm long, with central red-brown stripe; upper pinnae concave; spores 24–35 µm in diameter (growing on non-calcareous rock, e.g at Mt Buffalo, Benambra, Cudgewa-Pine Mtn area in far north-east)
